definition: centrally-managed state-owned enterprise (PRC), abbr. for 中央企業|中央企业[zhong1 yang1 qi3 ye4]
to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]

sentences.english: China revs up central enterprise regrouping.
China Securities Journal news, recently, the pace of State-owned Key Enterprises reform has been further accelerated.
sentences.chinese: 中证报消息，近期，央企改革步伐进一步提速。

sentences.english: There was 196 CSE when the Commission was established in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 在国资委2003年成立时，央企数量达196家。

sentences.english: In addition, the relevant department previously said plan raise profit ratio over scholars from renmin.
sentences.chinese: 此外，有关部门此前表示计划上调央企上缴利润比例。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, industry of real-estate of center look forward to exits progress slower also.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，央企房地产行业退出进展也较缓慢。

sentences.english: Of 217 industrial enterprises owned by the central government in 2010, 59 made losses (see chart 7).
sentences.chinese: 印度央企的217家企业中，有59家都是亏损的。

definition: state enterprise/(Tw) abbr. for 國際企業管理|国际企业管理, international business management (as a subject of study)
see 國務院國有資產監督管理委員會|国务院国有资产监督管理委员会[Guo2 wu4 yuan4 Guo2 you3 Zi1 chan3 Jian1 du1 Guan3 li3 Wei3 yuan2 hui4]
privately run (i.e. by a company, not the state)
China Petroleum and Chemical Corporation, Sinopec/abbr. for 中國石油化工股份有限公司|中国石油化工股份有限公司
abbr. for 外商獨資企業|外商独资企业[wai4 shang1 du2 zi1 qi3 ye4]
to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]
to own a controlling number of shares in a company
